title: Not Vaccinated? In Singapore, You’ll Pay for Your Own Covid-19 Treatment
sub_head: People who haven’t received shots account for a disproportionate amount of the strain on healthcare resources, authorities say
body:
SINGAPORE—As countries battle to persuade holdouts to get vaccinated, Singapore has settled on one of the most aggressive strategies: The city-state is going to stop fully covering Covid-19 medical bills for the unvaccinated.
Singapore’s government has paid the full treatment costs of nearly all Covid-19 patients since last year, under a pandemic-era policy to ensure financial considerations wouldn’t add to public concern about the disease. On Wednesday, the government withdrew that support for those who choose to go unvaccinated.
